body:
### Describe the bug

SciPy `main` cannot build with Cython `3.0.3` and I bisected on Cython commits:

```
401e880a336576b765e5d6bb1a9718947243d92b is the first bad commit
commit 401e880a336576b765e5d6bb1a9718947243d92b
Author: da-woods <dw-git@d-woods.co.uk>
Date:   Fri Sep 29 11:11:22 2023 +0100

    Show performance hints for nogil functions requiring exception checks (GH-5673)
    
    Performance hints come out similar to warnings but do not make `-Werror` fail.

 Cython/Compiler/Errors.py       | 14 +++++++++
 Cython/Compiler/ExprNodes.py    |  7 +++--
 Cython/Compiler/Nodes.py        |  3 +-
 Cython/Compiler/Options.py      |  4 +++
 Cython/Compiler/PyrexTypes.py   | 13 ++++++++-
 Cython/Compiler/Scanning.py     |  1 +
 Cython/Compiler/Symtab.py       | 12 ++++++++
 Cython/Compiler/TreeFragment.py |  8 +++++-
 Cython/Compiler/UtilityCode.py  |  3 +-
 runtests.py                     | 64 +++++++++++++++++++++++++----------------
 tests/run/nogil.pxd             |  1 +
 tests/run/nogil.pyx             | 39 ++++++++++++++++++++++++-
 tests/run/nogil_other.pxd       |  2 ++
 13 files changed, 138 insertions(+), 33 deletions(-)
 create mode 100644 tests/run/nogil.pxd
 create mode 100644 tests/run/nogil_other.pxd
```

This appears to be slightly different than gh-5747 from `pandas`, though perhaps some similarity.

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

_No response_

### Expected behaviour

_No response_

### OS

_No response_

### Python version

_No response_

### Cython version

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body:
Errors as reported in https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5747:
```
  pandas/_libs/tslibs/nattype.cpython-310-aarch64-linux-gnu.so.p/pandas/_libs/tslibs/nattype.pyx.c:8729:26: error: static declaration of ‘__pyx_f_6pandas_5_libs_6tslibs_4util_is_timedelta64_object’ follows non-static declaration
   8729 | static CYTHON_INLINE int __pyx_f_6pandas_5_libs_6tslibs_4util_is_timedelta64_object(PyObject *__pyx_v_obj) {
        |                          ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  pandas/_libs/tslibs/nattype.cpython-310-aarch64-linux-gnu.so.p/pandas/_libs/tslibs/nattype.pyx.c:8492:17: note: previous implicit declaration of ‘__pyx_f_6pandas_5_libs_6tslibs_4util_is_timedelta64_object’ was here
   8492 |   __pyx_t_2 = (!__pyx_f_6pandas_5_libs_6tslibs_4util_is_timedelta64_object(__pyx_v_obj));
```

Bug was introduced in the pxd related changes in https://github.com/cython/cython/commit/401e880a336576b765e5d6bb1a9718947243d92b (https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/5673)

OK, this is diff between correctly compiled `_ufunc.pyx` file and wrong one:

![image](https://github.com/cython/cython/assets/827060/8b2345ee-4544-42fa-8a82-a85d2cecd1bc)

The issue is that all declarations are missing. It seems that adding back following line makes the diff the same:

https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/5673/files#diff-8789a479ea870f7646251224385afa3ebffe9b6acab136ff55011b31386ddd84L2700

(But I am not sure if it does not break something else, I didn't go deep with investigation)

Or possibly Symtab L917 should be:

```
entry.inline_func_in_pxd = True
```

(To properly replace the line removed from Nodes.py).

Thanks for the further investigation @matusvalo

> Or possibly Symtab L917 should be:
> 
> ```
> entry.inline_func_in_pxd = True
> ```
> 
> (To properly replace the line removed from Nodes.py).
> 
> Thanks for the further investigation @matusvalo

Yes I confirm. I suppose it was a typo. I tried quickly to create isolated reproducer but I was not lucky. If someone can help with that, I think we can create PR...

I've created a PR of just the one line change. Unfortunately I can't work out how to make an isolated test either, which is unhelpful because it's clearly a common issue that's completely missing in the test suite

>  Unfortunately I can't work out how to make an isolated test

@da-woods I got the reproducer! The issue is when inline function calls another inline function in pxd file:

```cython
######## bb.pxd ########
cdef inline int bar():
    return foo()


cdef inline int foo():
    return 5

######## aa.pyx ########
from bb cimport bar

bar()
```

Compiling `aa.pyx` fails with an error on master:

```
cythonize -3fib aa.pyx

/Users/matus/dev/cython/test/scipy/cc.c:1896:15: error: implicit declaration of function '__pyx_f_2bb_foo' is invalid in
      C99 [-Werror,-Wimplicit-function-declaration]
  __pyx_t_1 = __pyx_f_2bb_foo(); if (unlikely(__pyx_t_1 == ((int)-1) && PyErr_Occurred())) __PYX_ERR(0, 2, __pyx_L1_error)
              ^
/Users/matus/dev/cython/test/scipy/aa.c:1896:15: note: did you mean '__pyx_f_2bb_bar'?
/Users/matus/dev/cython/test/scipy/aa.c:1883:26: note: '__pyx_f_2bb_bar' declared here
static CYTHON_INLINE int __pyx_f_2bb_bar(void) {
                         ^
/Users/matus/dev/cython/test/scipy/aa.c:1921:26: error: static declaration of '__pyx_f_2bb_foo' follows non-static
      declaration
static CYTHON_INLINE int __pyx_f_2bb_foo(void) {
                         ^
/Users/matus/dev/cython/test/scipy/aa.c:1896:15: note: previous implicit declaration is here
  __pyx_t_1 = __pyx_f_2bb_foo(); if (unlikely(__pyx_t_1 == ((int)-1) && PyErr_Occurred())) __PYX_ERR(0, 2, __pyx_L1_error)
              ^
2 errors generated.
error: command '/usr/bin/clang' failed with exit code 1
```

Update: Also I can confirm that PR #5752 fixes the reproducer.

Ah, nice. Yes, that fails. Here's a test diff that fails to build for me:
```diff
diff --git a/tests/run/inlinepxd.pyx b/tests/run/inlinepxd.pyx
index 65c596c36..f9f31f71e 100644
--- a/tests/run/inlinepxd.pyx
+++ b/tests/run/inlinepxd.pyx
@@ -42,3 +42,12 @@ def test_wraparound():
     # the wraparound directive from this scope should not affect the inline pxd
     a = [ 0.0, 1.0 ]
     return inlinepxd_support.index(a)
+
+
+def test_call_inlined(L):
+    """
+    >>> test_call_inlined([1, 2, 3])
+    3
+    """
+    return inlinepxd_support.call_index(L)
+
diff --git a/tests/run/inlinepxd_support.pxd b/tests/run/inlinepxd_support.pxd
index 863f4eaf1..4fd01ef11 100644
--- a/tests/run/inlinepxd_support.pxd
+++ b/tests/run/inlinepxd_support.pxd
@@ -2,8 +2,12 @@
 cdef inline int my_add(int a, int b=1, int c=0):
     return a + b + c
 
+
+cdef inline call_index(list L):
+    return index(L)
+
+
```
I'm sure I tried that idea and didn't get anywhere with it! I'll copy it over to the PR and then we should be good
